TopicTitle: Can Infernal Robotics be made to support massive parts like the B9's HX parts?

Articles.Content:
I tried to "just do it", and create a rotating engine module and they just flopped around like a wet noodle. I know you cant use struts to shore them up, it'll torque the part when you move/rotate it, so I'm wondering how this would be possible.

Is there a way to shore up the part and still have it rotate, or modify the part's so they have 0 flex?

As usual, thanks for your time!

You can try [active struts](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/96361-0-25-ActiveStruts-Create-remove-struts-in-flight-editor-v1-0-10-10-2014) that has moving struts which will extend and retract as needed. And I hope you have Tweakscale and already use the largest size IR parts available for you.

Honestly though, I wouldn't suggest you making those massive things movable using the IR parts. They aren't designed handle something that big. They would need a custom-made part for them.
Active struts doesnt appear to do what I'll need them to do. I've never made my own parts before, how would I go about that?
